introText: M.O.M.: Mother of Madness sparked a niche but notable creative ripple, with selective fan art, brief meme activity, and modest industry nods. Overall fan-made output stayed limited given its short, one-off run.

stats.label: TikTok Reach
stats.trend: Skits in tens of thousands of views; no viral trend/sound

stats.label: Industry Recognition
stats.trend: Eisner panel mention; collectible variant covers

highlights.title: Fan Art
highlights.description: Handful of tributes, including a woodcut cover reposted on IG with 2.7K likes; few entries on DeviantArt/Pixiv.

highlights.title: Memes
highlights.description: Twitter jokes about period-powered abilities and small TikTok skits; minimal reaction GIF usage, no viral trend.

highlights.title: Fanfiction
highlights.description: No entries on AO3 or FanFiction.net; no roleplay or tabletop adaptations observed.

highlights.title: Professional Art
highlights.description: Variant covers by Jen Bartel and Mirka Andolfo became collectible; Leila Leiz’s pages shown at art exhibits.

highlights.title: Coverage
highlights.description: Cited in discussions of menstruation/representation; mentioned on TV Tropes, Cracked, and podcasts as a quirky standout.

closingText: The series’ creative echo is modest but memorable, fueling select art, light meme traction, and discourse on representation more than a sustained fan-creation scene.
